title: Medibank says it won't pay a ransom despite threats to leak data
description: The risk of paying is even greater than that of the private data being leaked, Medibank CEO says.

title: You can now print emoji in Google Workspace spreadsheets, should you ever want to
description: Print out your favorite emoji-covered spreadsheets thanks to this Google Workspace Sheets update.

title: Apple could be tracking your every move in the App Store
description: Even single taps are being tracked and sent directly to Apple, researchers find.

title: Your next big Zoom meeting might take place at a cinema
description: Zoom signs partnership with movie theatre chain AMC which could see work meetings coming to a cinema near you.

title: Chip giants join together in new aim to cut down semiconductor emissions
description: Semiconductor leaders meet at COP27 to brainstorm ways to cut the industry's environmental footprint.

title: Nvidia's canceled RTX 4080 12GB could come back from the dead with a new name
description: According to leaks, we may see the RTX 4080 12GB in the form of an RTX 4070 Ti in early January.

title: The Xbox Series X could be getting new graphics modes that can save you money
description: Microsoft is looking into new energy saving modes on the Xbox Series X which could impact in-game frame rate and resolution

title: LG’s new stretchable high-res display is bizarre but brilliant
description: LG has debuted a new form of stretchable display panel.

title: This Microsoft Teams update might solve one of your biggest office problems
description: New Microsoft Teams Files App should help you keep track of everything you need.

title: The ultimate all-in-one for streamers, singers, podcasters and audio pros
description: Everywhere’s a studio with the astonishing RØDECaster Pro II

title: iFi Uno is a tiny, cheap DAC that easily upgrades sound from your phone or laptop
description: The British brand’s dinky (and relatively affordable) $79 DAC won’t burn a hole in your pocket ahead of the festive season.

title: This Sonos-style amp from SVS turns any speaker into a streaming machine
description: This feature-packed  amp from SVS is like a complete hi-fi in one – just add speakers.

title: This rather odd ransomware deletes your data just a few bytes at a time
description: Azov Ransomware replaces every other 666 bytes of data with junk, rendering the entire device useless

title: Oculus founder's modified Meta Quest Pro takes immersive VR too far
description: Palmer Luckey, the founder of Oculus, has created a modified Meta Quest Pro that explodes if you fail in a video game.

title: A Nintendo Switch price increase could be on the horizon
description: The Nintendo Switch won't be getting a price increase anytime soon, the company confirmed recently.

title: Mozilla is offering $35 million to ‘responsible’ startups
description: Pool of $35 million available to tech startups who maintain the values of “privacy, inclusion, transparency, and human dignity”.

title: Garmin takes swipe at Apple with its 'months, not days' Instinct Crossover battery life
description: Garmin Instinct Crossover has analog hands, but all Garmin's usual smarts and a potentially infinite battery life.

title: Here’s what a PS5 Slim could mean for the current console generation
description: It’s been reported that a PS5 Slim could be coming in 2023, with the console revision featuring a removable disc drive.

title: Businesses everywhere are still spending a huge amount on databases
description: IDC report shows continual growth in data management spend for all kinds of companies.

title: Apple’s life-saving satellite feature could arrive in your iPhone 14's next update
description: Apple has shared a tentative release date for its highly-anticipated Emergency SOS via Satellite feature.

title: The FBI says Russian hacktivists are only seeing 'limited' success with DDoS attacks
description: These attacks have been more of a nuisance than an actual threat, the FBI claims.

title: McDonald’s enters the PC gaming scene: could the KFConsole have competition?
description: This isn’t the first time a fast-food chain has tried to muscle in on the gaming space, and it won’t be the last.

title: Netflix's Gears of War movie will only work with one big change
description: Netflix is making a live-action Gears of War film – but there's only one way it'll actually work.

title: Google and Renault are building a "software defined vehicle"
description: New Renault cars will send data to Google Cloud servers for faster processing.

title: Microsoft is testing ads in Windows 11 to help you move to a Mac for Black Friday
description: A user discovered a OneDrive ad when they went to shut down their PC, and there's others that have been found since.

title: Audio Pro Link2 lets you add streaming smarts to vintage hi-fi
description: You can now add Spotify and Tidal Connect to your ‘dumb’ hi-fi with Audio Pro’s latest streaming AirPlay 2/Google Cast hub.

title: Norton LifeLock rebrands as Gen following Avast acquistion
description: Gen will have two headquarters, and more than 500 million customers.

title: Walmart has a Chromebook for just $79 in its early Black Friday deals
description: Walmart currently has one of the cheapest Chromebook deals we've seen this year in its early Black Friday sale.

title: The AMD Radeon RX 7900 XTX is a massive step in the right direction
description: Between AMD's new Ryzen processors and Radeon RX graphics cards, it might be time for me to make the jump to Team Red.

title: Airbnb hidden fees are about to check out - for good
description: Airbnb will display a location's total listing price and add new educational resources for Hosts.

title: Aussie consumer watchdog is taking Dell to court over misleading discounts
description: PC dynamo Dell has run afoul of the ACCC, following allegations of the tech company “inflating” some offers.
